entry.title: Table change not possible. There is a db trigger on the table
entry.content: "Table change not possible. There is a DB trigger on the table." I am facing this issue; how to solve this?

entry.title: Data Services Manager, change DB server name, cannot add in repository, BODI-310079 Already exists
entry.content:
Our SQL servers are being refreshed and the DBAs have created new aliases to connect to the existing servers to make it easier when they switch over to the new ones.  In SAP Data Services Server Manager under the Job Server Properties the server name field is grayed out for editing so I removed the base LREPO_DEV repository and tried to re-add it in using the server alias in the DB Server Name and I am now getting an error stating that the repo already exists, BODI-310079.  The repo no longer shows in the list of existing repositories and I have also removed the section in the DSConfig file located in the D:\SAP BusinessObjects\Data Services\conf\migrated directory.  The DSConfig file in the D:\SAP BusinessObjects\Data Services\conf directory does not contain any repo specific entries.  I was also able to update the server name in the CMC without issue, I just have not deleted the repo from there due to the possible loss of existing DEV work that our dev team has been working on.

Any help on this would be greatly appreciated, I have tried everything I could that I found on this KB and other searches for this error and nothing has helped so far.

entry.title: Sap Data Services
entry.content:
Hi team, I am creating a job for the JOB log execution history for a particular job in BODS.  the variables are defined in global variables as start time end time and error log. execution history table is created into the hana. after post script. I have created a data flow in which put SQL transform and target table . but in the SQL transform given the insert statement to map the variables to target table columns. while validating it. I am getting an error like cannot use parameter variable. 

 

please help to solve the error ..thank you

entry.title: Extract data from S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using SAP Data Services (BODS)
entry.content:
I assume the "Migrate your data" app is the only option to perform the initial data load into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition . Does this mean that IDoc or BAPI-based data loads (by calling them from SAP Data Services) are not supported?

Additionally, I'm hoping to extract SAP table data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  using SAP Data Services with a data store connection established via a cloud connector. Is this a feasible approach?

entry.title: Data Service - Schema Header
entry.content:
Hi, everyone.

I need a small help on SAP Data Services with the schema's header on query or looking at a table.

When looking at a table, my header is "Type", "Type" and "Content Type". (Image 3)

I would like to change it do include Description, as it will help me a lot during mapping for migration. (Image 2)

I found an option that I thought it would do the trick, but even setting it exactly as another project (print shown above), it didn't change. (Image 1)

entry.title: JSON not supported using the Datastore connection WebServiceREST
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts, 


We are using SAP Data Services of version 4.3 SP2. The database is Microsoft SQL Server 2022.
We are trying to read the data using the WebservieREST connection. Using the SAP Article, the web-service endpoint is reachable however the response is received in the form of JSON and not the XML. We contacted the vendor; they said that the API can only return JSON.
Can you please help how to load the data if the response is in the form of JSON?

entry.title: Extract selected data from very large Hana table using sap Data Services
entry.content:
We would like to using SAP Data Services to copy data from SAP Hana database Production to the Test system,  for a very large table (over 1 Billion records), but only for specific selections.  So we currently have a Job with a Dataflow, with a query with a where statement and a Data Transfer transformation.  This takes about 3 hours to select around 6 million records.  Currenly all the data in the S/4 table is first selected and then the where is carried out.  Is there anyway that we can "push" the Where down to the SAP Hana database select?

We are using Data Services version 14.3.3

entry.title: CMS connection error during Data Services Client installation
entry.content:
Hi,

We are attempting to install SAP DS 2005 Designer on the client machine; however, the installation is resulting in an error.

"Please check the CMS connection information, make sure they are correct and the CMS is up and running, then try again."

The server installation was completed successfully, and the CMS is up and running.
Additionally, the CMC is accessible from the client machine without any issues.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

  1. The server was successfully installed on Windows Server 2022 and is up and running.
  2. Access to the CMC from the client machine was tested and is working correctly.
  3. However, an error occurs when attempting to install the client tools on the client machine — a CMS connectivity error is being thrown.

entry.title: User Id locked BODS are automated with that id
entry.content:
For integrating data from outside api to s4hana using bods (sap data services). With one user id the jobs are automated now that user is locked due to inactive for past 45 days now jobs running but data is not replicating in the s4hana. Here my assumption the user id is locked is it true or any other reasons can be here.
Sharing your views and suggestions it helps me alot.

SAP Data Services 

SAP BusinessObjects Dashboards 

SAP S/4HANA for advanced ATP

entry.title: Bods job running but data is not integration from api to s4hana
entry.content:
Bods jobs are automated with one user id in s4hana to integrate the data from api to s4hana. But recently that user id is locked due to inactive now the data is not integrating from api to s4hana even though that bods jobs are running. My assumption is that user id locked. This is main reason or any other reasons causing to integrating data from api to s4hana.
Any knowledge on this issue can help me alot.

entry.title: SAP Information Platform Services installation for SAP DS Client Installation
entry.content:
Hi,

I am trying to install the SAP DS client in the laptop, and it is throwing below warnings after entering the CMS information.

No valid local SIA nodes exist for the given CMS connection information. You will not be able to install APS Services (RFC Server, Administrator, Metadata, Viewdata, and Job Launcher).

If we click continue below option are greyed out.  I could not find any DS Client 2025 installation step. Please let me know prerequisites.

Adaptive Processing Server (APS) services, and Management Console features.

Thanks & Regards,

Ramana

entry.title: SAP Data Services pre-installation check failing
entry.content:
Hello everyone
I'm having a problem installing SAP Data Services 4.3 SP3 PL08
 
The operating system is:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux release 9.5 (Plow)
 
I installed IPS 4.3 SP05 Patch 1 without any problem using the "IPS4305P_100-70002777.tar" package.
I can access the CMC without any problem and, from there, the product version is confirmed:
SAP BusinessObjects BI Platform 4.3 Support Pack 5 Patch 1
Version: 14.3.5.5429
 
As a database I chose SQL Anywhere installed directly from the IPS installer.
 
When I try to install Data Services, the pre-installation checks give me the following errors:
 
***pasted text ***
 
Summary of any missing critical or optional prerequisites.
 
Failed: Check KSH (Critical)
Information: The ksh(/bin/ksh) was not installed. You must install ksh before the installation program can continue.
 
Failed: 
Minimum patch level requirements for OS (Critical) Information: [CheckPatchLevelFailReason]
 
Failed: SAP Information platform services Version (Critical)
Information: SAP Information platform services or SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence platform is detected on this machine, but the version is not compatible. Data Services 4.3 requires SAP Information platform services or BusinessObjects Business Intelligence platform 4.3 SP1 or above versions.
 
Failed: Disk space in /var (Critical)
Information: The /var folder does not have enough free disk space. You must make available 20 MB or more of disk space before the installation can continue.
 
***End of pasted text ***
 
Initially, indeed, ksh was not present on the Linux system but, even after installing it, I got the same errors (I also rebooted the Linux machine and tried again... same error).
I tried redownloading the Data Services package (same error).
I tried installing Data Services with a lower patch level installation package (same error).
I tried reinstalling everything (including IPS) to a different folder (not sure what to do)... same error again !
 
I checked and double-checked that, both the Linux version (on the PAM) and the IPS version (in note 3197694) are correct for Data Services 4.3 SP3 PL08.
As for the last error, even, in the fs "/var" there are 19GB free!
 
Does anyone have any idea why these checks fail?
Is it possible that ksh was not installed correctly (I didn't do it but the Linux system administrator) and the subsequent checks fail because of this?
 
Please help me.
Thank you very much.
Andrea.

entry.title: DS Designer 4.3 SP03 PL8 does not connect
entry.content:
Hello everyone

A colleague of mine is unable to connect, with Data Services Designer 4.3 SP03 PL8 installed on his notebook, with Windows 11, to a DS server at the exact same version installed in a customer's network.

After filling in the server parameters, port, username and password, clicking on "log on", instead of getting the list of repositories, gets this error:

I succeed without any problem.

Consider that:

  1. We used exactly the same installation file to install the DS Designer.
  2. We installed exactly the same DS Designer components.
  3. We both connect to the customer's network, from our notebooks (subject to the same company policies) via a VPN client and get IP addresses in the same subnet.
  4. The CMS is, by default, listening on port 6400 and the CMS request port is set on 6405. We are both able to telnet the IP address of the DS server from our notebooks on both port 6400 and port 6405 of the server, successfully.
  5. He gets the same error even when starting DS Designer "as Administrator".
  6. He also gets the same error when turning off the Windows Defender firewall before trying to connect the DS Designer.
  7. If I do a traffic capture with Wireshark, I see communications, both on port 6400 and on 6405. On his notebook, there are communications on the 6400 but nothing on the 6405.
  8. He gets the same error trying to connect with two different users (both work for me).
  9. We both reach, via browser, the CMC on port 8080.
  10. We tried to configure the request port of the CMS to 6408 but the result is exactly the same.
  11. It gets this error on two different DS servers (development and production). I can log in, without problems, on both.

What do you think? Does anyone have something to suggest ?

Thank you all !

entry.title: Fill BODS variables from a sql database
entry.content:
HI,

i have an sql datastore called "EM_DATASERVICES". There i have the database "EM_DATASERVICES_DEV".

I have created the table "SELECTION_EXPRESSION_RESULT".  There i have the colums "Variable" and "Expression".

I have loaded this table to BODS. Now i will update the variable in BODS with the value from column "Expression".

I create a script in the workflow:

$G_WERKS = sql('EM_DATASERVICES','SELECT Expression FROM SELECTION_EXPRESSION_RESULT WHERE Variable = ''$G_WERKS''');

And i got this error:

[Script:Script530]
(Ln 1) : Syntax error : near <'> found <;> expecting <')', ','>

What did i wrong?

Thanks TA

entry.title: SAP Data Services Job "Hangs" Occasionally. Requires "Abort"
entry.content:
We have 1 SAP DS job, scheduled every 30 minutes,  that hangs occasionally, for no apparent reason. We have to manually abort it, so that it will run at the next interval. I looked at the Windows Task Scheduler for the job, and it shows "Task Completed" after about 1 minute, so the Windows task is not hung. Apparently it is stuck within the SAP job application.

In Management Console, the "End Time" is blank, although the steps have completed.

Any thoughts about how to solve this ?

SAP Data Services
Version: 14.2.13.25270479

entry.title: ERROR 80101
entry.content:
Hi

 

I am having an issue when executing my job in SAP DS. So I am pulling in an Excel file and executing my job but I keep on getting error message 80101. 

I have checked the file path and that looks correct and I also have checked the permission within the excel file and looks correct as well.So I am bit stumped as to what to do. If it helps I am currently running SAP DS on a remote desktop that is downloaded on my local machine.

080101: |Data flow DF_Players_Stat
Cannot open file <C:/Users/mhussain/football_dataset_for_sap_designer.xlsx>. Please check the files path and permissions.

entry.title: Is Hyphen supported for Server Name in SAP Data Services?
entry.content:
Using a hyphen (-) in the hostname is fully supported for DS/IPS installation and operation?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: is SAP BODS capable to write to Microsoft Fabric Warehouse?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
I'm trying to write to Microsoft Fabric with SAP BODS.

I can not create a working BODS Datastore with Fabric (datastore type: database, database type: Microsoft).

I can create an ODBC based datastore and for data reading it works.

when I try to write to MS Fabric warehouse, BODS is haging during the write, the problem seems to be on the commit as the files under the delta tables are created.

Have you experienced this? (BODS 4.2.14, odbc driver for SQL server version 17).

Thanks,
Alberto
